title: Why Did It Take HBO So Long to Make Shows About Women?
description: An early top executive at the network believed that “the man of the house” paid for cable TV subscriptions. That mind-set affected HBO’s programming for decades.
dc:creator: John Koblin
media:description: More than a decade after “The Sopranos” had its finale, HBO’s “Big Little Lies” was the toast of the Emmys. From left: Laura Dern, Nicole Kidman, Zoe Kravitz, Reese Witherspoon and Shailene Woodley.
